byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ERIC LIPTON

abstract: Office of Government Ethics informs lawyers for Pres-elect Donald J Trump that only divestiture of his financial stake in his real estate business will resolve ethical concerns about conflicts of interest; agency appears to conclude, wrongly, that Trump had committed to divesting his assets after he offered vague promise to separate himself from his business dealings and hand them over to his children.

headline.print_headline: An Ethics Agency Gets Excited by Trump’s Vague Financial Vow
headline.main: Ethics Office Praises Donald Trump for a Move He Hasn’t Committed To

snippet: In a series of oddly informal Twitter posts, the Office of Government Ethics appeared to conclude, wrongly, that Mr. Trump had promised to divest his assets....
lead_paragraph: In a series of oddly informal Twitter posts, the Office of Government Ethics appeared to conclude, wrongly, that Mr. Trump had promised to divest his assets.
